entry.title: [base] Adjust CPU reduction experiment API for next optimization round.
entry.content:
The Catan team will use the API for simple optimizations that don't

deserve their own Feature (a dedicated feature may be worthwhile for

any substantial optimization).



In preparation for this:



- Rename the feature: ReduceCpuUtilization -> ReduceCpuUtilization2,

to avoid any confusion in experiment setups.



- The feature is kept ENABLED_BY_DEFAULT so that impact is immediately

reflected on perf bots. It will still be possible to conduct to

disable it in a hold back experiment.



- ShouldLogHistogramForCpuReductionExperiment() is kept, in case we

have new histogram sub-sampling optimizations.

entry.title: [Test Automation] Improvements to WaitForStateChange()
entry.content:
Addressing concerns in the attached bug. There are some tests for which navigation can happen at odd times or as the result of asynchronous processes. If only the end state is being tested, allowing a StateChange to not care if the page navigates (or becomes momentarily unavailable) increases the number of tests that can be made reliable and non-flaky.



This CL adds a new field to StateChange, continue_across_navigation. When set, WaitForStateChange() will not immediately fail if the page navigates or becomes momentarily unavailable.



The CL also addresses an issue where many StateChange structs that were declared had parameters that did not match the default StateChange::Type, but worked accidentally due to implementation details of the system.



The type of the change now defaults to a new `kAuto` value which causes auto-inference of the type based on the parameters, since in the vast majority of cases it's obvious from the parameters that are set. This puts less onus on the person writing the test and doesn't force them to set a redundant parameter. It also reflects the old default behavior - in other words, it makes explicit what people were already doing (previously incorrectly, now correct).



Bug: b/303402087

entry.title: Pass --disable-field-trial-config to tests that need it.
entry.content:
Affected tests already run without the testing config applied,

so this CL makes it explicit.



Context: Browser tests that use ScopedFeatureList and pass

params presently cause the field trial testing config to be

entirely disabled. (details: crbug.com/1491463#c8)

We plan to fix this, but some existing tests rely on this

(fail with the testing config). This CL annotates those

tests explicitly by making them specify the flag for that.



Once all the CLs updating such tests land (sharded via git

cl split), the following CL to make ScopedFeatureList not

disable the testing config can land:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935093



As many tests are affected, it will be up to their owners

to do any necessary follow up if the tests should be made to

pass with the testing config (per the comments this CL adds).



Note: I did a best effort to have the new flag only apply to the

subset of tests that needed it when it was a single or a small

number of tests that were affected, by introducing subclasses

for the affected tests. In other cases, where lots of tests in

the same file fail, the flag is added to the original test class.



Note: The --disable-field-trial-config flag is passed simply

by name intentionally, to avoid additional complexity from

depending on components/variations and includes to reference

the existing constant for it. The name is unlikely to change and

this way, we need less complex code to add this to the tests.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=sophiechang@chromium.org

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4936473

entry.title: Revert "Skip line caps for closed ellipse paths"
entry.content:
This reverts commit a7c44e6c2a28134ad01add05c3a0b7ec2f6e441a.



Reason for revert: line caps for closed subpath are supposed to be

skipped. But full ellipse are arcs, not closed paths according to

spec, https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/canvas.html#ellipse-method-steps.



Original change's description:

> Skip line caps for closed ellipse paths

>

> As discussed in the github issue, https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/1079, it's generally agreed to skip drawing line caps for closed paths. Add test cases for full

> ellipse path.

entry.title: android: Add new experimental cold start histograms
entry.content:
The histograms track tab/page events via new class

ExperimentalStartupMetricsTracker, which borrows a lot from the

ActivityTabStartupMetricsTracker, but has a simpler internal state

management. Eventually only one of these trackers will survive, so I

chose not to optimize for code reuse and rather prefer to optimize for

simplicity of removing one or another.



New histograms are prefixed with "Startup.Android.Experimental.":



* FirstNavigationCommit.Tabbed.ColdStartTracker - based on

ColdStartTracker and SimpleStartupForegroundSessionDetector



* FirstNavigationCommit.Tabbed.ActivityCreatedWhileInit - only recorded

when activity was created before post-inflation (this was the easiest

thing to intercept)



* FirstContentfulPaint.Tabbed.ColdStartTracker and

FirstContentfulPaint.Tabbed.ActivityCreatedWhileInit analogously

record FCP



Filtering webpage/navigation events is mostly the same as with the

v2 startup metrics, but not without subtleties: FRE/CCT/WebAPK detection

is handled differently.

entry.title: [Auto-disable Accessibility] Fix a11y recreate issue with ToolbarManager
entry.content:
This CL adds a temporary solution to the infinite recreate issue that is

blocking the M118 release.



With this CL we add new methods for checking the AccessibilityState and

whether or not any gesture performing or touch exploration accessibility

services are enabled. These methods will ignore any caching and fetch a

fresh value. This will have a negative performance impact, so we minimize

this to the ToolbarManager related code by added duplicate methods where

required to create a separate code path. No other clients of the

ReturnToChromeUtil should be affected by this change.

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Fix warning dialog when updating on metered connection
entry.content:
As evident in the feedback reports in the bug, devices that are on a

metered connection (cellular, tether) are unable to update. In this

case, a warning dialog should show which prompts the user to consent

to downloading the update over their metered connection. However,

that warning dialog was not showing due to a misuse of innerHTML and

resulted in the device unable to update as long as they were on the

metered connection.



This CL avoids using innerHTML, the source of the error, altogether

and uses a plain element property instead for displaying the warning

message.

entry.title: Add a presubmit check for non-inlined constexpr definitions in headers.
entry.content:
Non-inlined constexpr variable definitions in a header lead every file

that includes this header to create a separate copy of the constant.

There appears to be no upside, but potential downsides (larger binary

size, differing memory addresses when one expect them to be equal)

from that behavior.



This CL adds a PRESUBMIT warning for changed or modified non-inline

constexpr variable definitions in headers. The check excludes

a) definitions in .cc files (which should hopefully not be included)

b) static constexpr member definitions inside structs and classes,

as these are implicitly inline.



Relevant links:

- https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/cxx/c/hmyGFD80ocE

(includes a discussion of adding this check)

- https://abseil.io/tips/168



Trial CL to just replace all non-inline constexpr seems to make bots

happy (apart from presubmit checks):

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4708325



Bug: 1467190

Change-Id: I187cecc0cb0676ee0e5950a6791f15cba96cb19c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4710609

Reviewed-by: Dominic Battre

Commit-Queue: Jan Keitel

Reviewed-by: danakj

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1209049}

entry.title: Android: Fix build server handling of stamp files
entry.content:
For context see: https://issuetracker.google.com/301961827



Previously on any termination of a running task the stamp file would be

deleted, but siso needs each target to create its output files before

terminating. So server_utils.py would create the stamp file, and then

fast_local_dev_server.py would delete it when terminating the unfinished

task, and siso would fail.



Avoid deleting the stamp file when a task is being replaced should fix

this behaviour for siso.



Bug: b/301961827

entry.title: Pass --disable-field-trial-config to tests that need it.
entry.content:
Affected tests already run without the testing config applied,

so this CL makes it explicit.



Context: Browser tests that use ScopedFeatureList and pass

params presently cause the field trial testing config to be

entirely disabled. (details: crbug.com/1491463#c8)

We plan to fix this, but some existing tests rely on this

(fail with the testing config). This CL annotates those

tests explicitly by making them specify the flag for that.



Once all the CLs updating such tests land (sharded via git

cl split), the following CL to make ScopedFeatureList not

disable the testing config can land:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935093



As many tests are affected, it will be up to their owners

to do any necessary follow up if the tests should be made to

pass with the testing config (per the comments this CL adds).



Note: I did a best effort to have the new flag only apply to the

subset of tests that needed it when it was a single or a small

number of tests that were affected, by introducing subclasses

for the affected tests. In other cases, where lots of tests in

the same file fail, the flag is added to the original test class.



Note: The --disable-field-trial-config flag is passed simply

by name intentionally, to avoid additional complexity from

depending on components/variations and includes to reference

the existing constant for it. The name is unlikely to change and

this way, we need less complex code to add this to the tests.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=wutao@chromium.org

entry.content:
This reverts the behavior change introduced by https://crrev.com/c/4859163,

but keeps the new tests (updated to reflect this change).



grabFrame() should not fail for muted tracks, but this change caused

some regressions since existing callers were not expecting the promise

to never resolve for tracks that never deliver a frame.



A possible solution is to add a timer, so that grabFrame() works as it

should but without creating the unexpected regression if a frame is

never delivered.

entry.title: Update UMA.AndroidPreNative.ChromeActivityCounter to account for aborted onCreate().
entry.content:
Context: The histogram UMA.AndroidPreNative.ChromeActivityCounter is meant to give info about the situation where Android Chrome's Java code starts to be executed, but there is an unexpected interruption in the Activity lifecycle before native code is reached. We're interested because this can potentially cause subtle shifts in daily user numbers when Java startup code is added or modified.



Explanation: In onCreate() from ChromeActivity's parent class AsyncInitializationActivity, onPreCreate() is called, which would cause Chrome.UMA.OnPreCreateCounter to be incremented in Prefs. However the activity would be aborted in onCreateInternal() after this under certain conditions, including first-run-experience:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/init/AsyncInitializationActivity.java;drc=f5bdc89c7395ed24f1b8d196a3bdd6232d5bf771;l=337



That would happen before native code was reached, so the counter would remain until the next browser startup, at which point the counters would be emitted as P2R1. We were able to easily reproduce this by reinstalling Chromium and going through the normal process to start the browser. So this is an expected interruption to the Activity Lifecycle and we were not intending to capture this.



To address this problem, the histogram is being replaced with UMA.AndroidPreNative.ChromeActivityCounter2, which increments the "onPostCreate" counter after onCreateInternal is successful. Explicitly we are waiting to see if willCreate is true here:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/init/AsyncInitializationActivity.java;drc=f5bdc89c7395ed24f1b8d196a3bdd6232d5bf771;l=303



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=Replaced with UMA.AndroidPreNative.ChromeActivityCounter2.



Bug: 1435048

Change-Id: I73dcb28cfac80c743126378b613f0112a634ce96

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4912374

Reviewed-by: Tommy Nyquist

Reviewed-by: Robert Kaplow

entry.title: Pass --disable-field-trial-config to tests that need it.
entry.content:
Affected tests already run without the testing config applied,

so this CL makes it explicit.



Context: Browser tests that use ScopedFeatureList and pass

params presently cause the field trial testing config to be

entirely disabled. (details: crbug.com/1491463#c8)

We plan to fix this, but some existing tests rely on this

(fail with the testing config). This CL annotates those

tests explicitly by making them specify the flag for that.



Once all the CLs updating such tests land (sharded via git

cl split), the following CL to make ScopedFeatureList not

disable the testing config can land:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935093



As many tests are affected, it will be up to their owners

to do any necessary follow up if the tests should be made to

pass with the testing config (per the comments this CL adds).



Note: I did a best effort to have the new flag only apply to the

subset of tests that needed it when it was a single or a small

number of tests that were affected, by introducing subclasses

for the affected tests. In other cases, where lots of tests in

the same file fail, the flag is added to the original test class.



Note: The --disable-field-trial-config flag is passed simply

by name intentionally, to avoid additional complexity from

depending on components/variations and includes to reference

the existing constant for it. The name is unlikely to change and

this way, we need less complex code to add this to the tests.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=wenyufu@chromium.org



Bug: 1491463

entry.title: [image search] Override the filter menu item for a11y
entry.content:
The current implementation for the checkbox items in the search filter

menu is using a normal menu item view with checkbox icons. These icons

are updated when the users toggle the item. However, the checkbox role

and check state have to be set for the chromevox to announce the

update. This cl overrides the MenuItemView to fulfill this requirement.

However, this may not be a optimal solution. We should consider using

a bubble with vertical content list to reimplement the whole menu.

entry.title: Revert "Do not build unit tests depending on safe libc++ if it is not enabled"
entry.content:
This reverts commit ef08fb754f940a894c60010623176466c6bf73bb.



Reason for revert: These unit tests should run unconditionally. The

reason is two-fold.



First, the tests exist to make sure we didn't make a mistake in our

build and accidentally disable safe mode for a supported

configuration. Whatever the right accommodation is for libstdc++,

this is not the right one as it introduces a security risk for

Chromium projects. Thus, it should be reverted and a new

accommodation attempted post-revert.



Second, this test reflects the Chromium project's development

assumptions. As documented in the security FAQ below, we treat

crashes from libc++ safe mode as functional bugs, not security bugs.

These tests reflect those assumptions. It is desirable for them to

fail in embedders whose STLs don't meet this. Embedders should either

fix their STLs to pass the tests, or go out of their way to ignore

the test failures. If they pick the latter, they are taking on a

security risk, so needing a manual step is desirable.



https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/faq.md#indexing-a-container-out-of-bounds-hits-a-libcpp_verbose_abort_is-this-a-security-bug



For libstdc++, probably the best option is to, as the original CL

description suggests, define _GLIBCXX_ASSERTIONS=1, not to suppress

the tests.



Original change's description:

> Do not build unit tests depending on safe libc++ if it is not enabled

>

> When use_safe_libcxx is enabled, then we build defining

> _LIBCPP_ENABLE_ASSERTIONS, that adds extra checks to libc++. This

> adds several tests that fail when using libstdc++.

>

> In the future we could be interested in building libstdc++ with its

> own assertions defining _GLIBCXX_ASSERTIONS=1. But for now, we remove

> flaky tests when they are not supported.

>

> Bug: 957519

> Change-Id: I8da050d93d18817833996266bebc8305c45cdb52

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4807532

> Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

> Commit-Queue: Jos Dapena Paz

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1188924}

entry.title: Fix extra white space in app menu bug
entry.content:
Before: https://hsv.googleplex.com/4675339159601152

After: https://hsv.googleplex.com/6247034609729536



Note: the line that was deleted in this cl was also causing the AppMenu

to be slightly longer than expected in some other edge cases where there

wasn't white space. However, after investigation, a shorter AppMenu in

these cases is working as intended, as we are supposed to display a

specific amount of the next item to indicate scrollability, instead of

take up the available vertical space:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/android/appmenu/internal/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/ui/appmenu/AppMenu.java;l=575-578;drc=81090fd5b036f4ca06a8b04da91242f929a27068.

entry.title: Revert "Rewrite program completion map in terms of GC'd data structures."
entry.content:
This reverts commit b4271929fae0765a6eb84a7935546b3952f6275e.



Reason for revert: caused crashes, crbug.com/1491984



Original change's description:

> Rewrite program completion map in terms of GC'd data structures.

>

> Since there is no HeapLinkedHashMap yet, maintain the program

> completion query map with a combined HeapHashMap mapping programs to

> their completion queries, and a HeapVector which maintains the

> ordering of additions to the map.

>

> Stress this revised code path with an enhancement to the

> KHR_parallel_shader_compile conformance test

> https://github.com/KhronosGroup/WebGL/pull/3597 .

entry.title: Fix Fluent Overlay scrollbar thumb hittest bug.
entry.content:
Thinning animation controller uses ComputeExpandedThumbQuadRect to see

if the pointer is on top of the thumb and check if the scrollbars

should consider themselves captured or not.

This function doesn't take into account that Fluent scrollbars' thumbs

have a margin between the track and the thumbs, and when clicking on

this margin the animation controller doesn't consider itself captured.



This CL:

- Reorganizes the code related to the thumb's rect calculation.

- ComputeExpandedThumbQuadRect is renamed to a more accurate

ComputeHitTestableExpandedThumbQuadRect

- Fixed a broken unittest that was not testing what it was meant to.

entry.title: Fix bug in android D&D introduced by https://crrev.com/c/4814086.
entry.content:
With CL 4814086 the renderer will pass the drop data to the page only

if the browser process does not force it to take a default action

instead.



This is indicated with the `force_default_action` boolean field of

`DropData` sent from the browser to the renderer. The field is true if

the document has not registered for the drop or if the browser

determines the data should not be passed to the document. For example,

an enterprise policy may prevent drops of sentitive data into

unsanctioned web pages.



The bug introduced by 4814086 on Android is that the document's interest

was not being saved by the browser process so the default assumed no

interest.



WebContentsViewAndroid now remembers whether the document has registered

interest in handling the drop and sets the corresponding field in the

`DropData` structure before passing it to the renderer.



Bug: 1489641

Change-Id: I7a70a662fed3dc787da9ddbc28ea051338369b01

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4936290

entry.content:
This name is in the form of :. When adding metadata to

the cache, GetUniqueName will be used to ensure the class is truly

unique. Duplicate class names in different scopes are valid but not

recommended. This will ensure there are no surprises.

screen rotates or resizes while open.

entry.content:

constexpr if it's short enough to fit in the short-string optimization.

is necessary to be able to update libc++.

per standard, see discussion on the pull request above.)

entry.title: Dictation: Fix disabled tests
entry.content:
The on-device variant of DictationTest were disabled due to high levels

of flakes. The reason for failure is in the

SendFinalResultAndWaitForEditableValue method; after sending a speech

result, we wait for a value changed event to be fired. For network

variants of this test, this works and is stable, but for on-device

variants, this never gets satisfied. The most plausible explanation

here is that on-device speech results get returned more slowly, and

by the time we call WaitForValueChangedEvent, the value changed event

has already been dispatched.



The fix here is to wait for a value changed event only if we're using

network speech recognition.



Fixed: 1490612

Change-Id: I0be45f221494f5727a97db9e2bd5b05a45fdfd9a

entry.title: [Test Automation] SendAccelerator to WebContents more reliable
entry.content:
Since some keypresses we think of as "accelerators" (such as RETURN and

ESC) are processed by WebContents as normal keypresses, and only

interpreted as special keys by Blink for the purpose of e.g. pressing

buttons, SendAccelerator() targeting an instrumented WebContents now

falls back to ui_controls::SendKeyPress() if SendAccelerator fails.

entry.title: Report browser process list in TabManagerDelegate
entry.content:
The tab process list is sent to the resource manager daemon (resourced).

The tab process list is used to estimate the memory usage of the

background and protected processes. Based on the Chrome memory usage,

resourced determines when to release memory from Chrome or VMs or

container. When there are a lot of background processes in Ash Chrome,

resourced avoids killing perceptible apps in VMs or container.



The process list reporting feature is already implemented in

OomScorePolicyChromeOS in performance_manager. Also implement the

process list reporting in TabManagerDelegate so the resonsive balloon

feature doesn't have to depend on feature

AshUrgentDiscardingFromPerformanceManager.



Bug: b/304679315

Change-Id: I41cdb2e9cb7928a639e9f1ac96e3ec672137aa2c

entry.title: Ensure the 'en_US.utf8' locale is installed via install-build-deps
entry.content:
In recent jammy upgrades of some machine types, we've noticed that they

don't have the en_US.utf8 installed or set as the default, leading to

some test failures, eg:

https://luci-milo.appspot.com/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/linux64/142828/overview



install-build-deps tries to install needed locales, but skips

en_US.utf8, probably because it's never been needed before. But

apparently starting with jammy it looks like it is needed. So this will

just explicitly install that locale as well. Should be safe if it's

already installed.

entry.title: Use weak pointer for PlatformSensorAndroid::NotifyPlatformSensorError
entry.content:
According to the finding in crbug.com/1446890, there seems to be a race

condition between PlatformSensorAndroid::~PlatformSensorAndroid and

PlatformSensorAndroid::NotifyPlatformSensorError. The race condition can

resurrect the ref count of a ref counted sensor object and lead to a

crash. This change fixes this race condition by using weak pointer with

the fact that the weak pointer is guaranteed valid during

PlatformSensorAndroid destructor as the weak pointer is the member of

the base class PlatformSensor.



Change-Id: I16a2c54e82826afde88e06494624344a4501e4b0

base. It means `base` is a `public_deps`, not an internal `deps`.

https://gn.googlesource.com/gn/+/master/docs/reference.md#discussion



Context: If we don't apply this patch, the PartitionAllocator library is

going to be properly propagated toward all of its dependants. It will

entry.title: [PA] Make base a public_deps of c/subresource_filter..rule_parser
entry.content:
The public interface of these targets do include several headers from

base. It means `base` is a `public_deps`, not an internal `deps`.



See GN doc explaining this:

https://gn.googlesource.com/gn/+/master/docs/reference.md#discussion



Context: If we don't apply this patch, the PartitionAllocator library is

not going to be able to stand alone completely. Its public_config is not

going to be properly propagated toward all of its dependants. It will

fail to compile some dependants who do not depends on base explicitly.



Bug: chromium:1467773

Change-Id: If89f81424bfa9f8944e373379d9f0010c6158b5f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4926653

entry.title: Don't access `this` in BrandcodeConfigFetcher after running the callback
entry.content:
The callback in BrandcodeConfigFetcher::OnSimpleLoaderComplete can be

run synchronously, which may delete `this`. Avoid accessing member

variables after running the callback to avoid a use-after-free.



Fixed: 1491296

entry.title: [layout] Fix/implement round-tripping of auto-margins in block layout
entry.content:
After crrev.com/c/4712468 we stopped correctly reporting auto margins

for new formatting contexts within block layout (instead returning

0px).



This patch implements round-tripping like servo (setting the value

will result in the layout not changing). This means that margin:auto

may have different values on the inline-start/inline-end sides.



Bug: 1486977

Change-Id: I7f767869a56ed7a7b8256b0990902474976cc93b
